reviews.text: Visited by accident, we we're just walking through.  What a great museum!  The Shrine and the other sections are really cool.  You are looking at history at it's best!  In the middle of downtown surrounded by beautiful parks! Best of all it's free!

One of the more 'iconic' monuments in Indianapolis this is just one of many must sees when downtown. The architecture is amazing with the bronze doors and overlooks a mall that faces towards the main library. This entire area is great on warm days just to relax or enjoy the mall.  Be sure to go up the stairs and take in as much of the history that is here....truly an amazing part of dedication to American History.

It's pretty good for a free museum. Only thing I didn't care for was listening to the chicken hawk "George W." Squawking over the speakers in the Iraq war area. The staff is really friendly, and helpful. It's a good way to spend a few hours.

Not really obvious from the outside, but inside there is a really interesting museum, about American war history. Also there is a very impressive shrine upstairs, that you should definitely visit. There is no entrance fee.

This is one of the best war memorials in the country. The history and architecture are really stunning. There is actually a military museum in the basement that is great. There is also a grand alter room on the top that takes your breath away. All in all, a very worthwhile place to visit.

It's nice to have such a well maintained, quality zoo so nearby.  We visit at least once per year. In fact, this is where my husband proposed. The diversity of animals is quite nice. Indy zoo is easy to navigate and always updating. We can't wait to visit this year.

Great zoo for a major city. Has a good flow to it that easily moves you from exhibit to exhibit. Clean and parent/family friendly. Of course, the crown jewel is the dolphin show - well trained dolphins doing fantastic tricks, while teaching the crowd about cleaning up the environment. Only thing that knocked a star off is the inherent smallness of the overall zoo; but still a respectable size for a zoo that apparently doesn't get any tax income to support it. Easy, fun trip for even just a half day with the family!

We had a fabulous time. My 7 year old LOVED the shark wall and the butterfly garden (they were magnetized to him) and my 3 year old loved the walrus the most! This zoo is smaller than some that I've been to hit you can tell they have invested into the space they have and the animals they have are great!

I have been to this zoo twice and it is my favorite zoo I've ever been to. There is a large variety of animals and even a dolphin show. One of their big attractions is their  orangutan program. They have many of them, they even put on shows where they will solve little puzzles for rewards. It's pretty neat. I always love to go here.

We had such an amazing time here! The butterfly exhibit was so neat being able to experience them in their environment. My sons really enjoyed petting the sharks. There were so many other great experiences here that made our spring break a success! We'll definitely return.
Our National staff are wonderful.
Good history museum
American Legion Post #1 Reno, Nevada reporting in.  We remain "Battle Born and Never Broken!"  Respectfully,  Legionnaire John Knott

As an active legion member and an active duty military member, it was an honor to visit The American Legion Headquarters. It is with great disgust I have to provide this review regarding the greeter inside the Headquarters building. I did not get her name but being the first line of sight and the one who provides the hospitality of The Legion, I was treated as if I was a homeless person walking in off the street. My wife who is also a retired veteran, wanted to view The Legion since we were driving back from Chicago on our way home to Dayton Ohio. We called 1 hr prior asking for the operation hours and quickly raced to their location before they closed to view the decor. As soon as we walked in at 415pm we were told "we close at 430pm." This was understood since we already called in advance. After asking to take a look around, the hostess said again "we close at 430pm." So with minutes to spare and tension in the air, my wife was allowed to walk down the hall. I then asked to use the restroom and with a disgusting glare was asked "is that the only reason you are here?" What a way to treat a military and legion member I think to myself. Finally after a brief discussion with the host, she followed us down the hall to closely observe our every step and was upset we were there. She called for security to continue the overbearing observation as she returned to her desk to talk down about us to someone internal on the phone. It is very unnerving. I honor my commitment to this organization and did not expect to be treated in this manner by someone who would be a fellow member. I understand that others may attempt at times to take advantage of this prestigious establishment. This was by no means the intent of our visit and now, unfortunately, our first impression of The Legion National Headquarters was unnecessarily ruined.  I hope and pray this review sparks someone to change the welcoming practices at The Legion Headquarters to ensure they are consistent with The Preamble to the Constitution of The American Legion..."to consecrate and sanctify our COMRADESHIP by our DEVOTION to MUTUAL HELPFULNESS."
Indianapolis 500

Outstanding structure's.  Reminds me of the time that I spend serving in the United States Marine Corps.  Lots of memories.
"We Will Never Forget"  Semper Fi (sem·per fi·de·lis)
Always Faithful!
Great experience even though the computer/television screen wasn't working.
What a fitting and unique Memorial to these Heroes. Really enjoyed it.
Nice looking memorial along the canal walk. It is a mostly quiet spot along what can be a very busy canal. The verbal narraration is a nice touch.
Beautiful monument to Congressional medal of Honor recipients. Wish I could have found a directory to look up location of particular honorees.

So so so great!! Very friendly and well educated staff. They constantly put work into the grounds. The greenhouse was my absolute favorite. It was extremely pleasant and a happy place to be in general. Guys!! Bring your lady here!! They will LOVE it. And you might too. There's a great big lake to walk around and site see. Perfect for when the weather is right. Absolutely recommend!

Did the Christmas lights walk and toured the Lilly house as part of that. Whole experience was more fun than I expected. Really well done. Appreciated the hand warming stations and the hot chocolate. Wine and whiskey seemed over the top.

This place sort of seemed like a waste of time. It was beautiful outside, but there was no reason to go inside. They just played a movie inside about the history of the place. If you're into that, you might like it.
We visited for the Christmas lights and it was beautiful! It's a bit pricey but well worth it. There is a paved path you walk or a wheelchair etc. could be used.
Amazing look at a beautiful old house. Complete with historically accurate decor and items throughout.

I love the State Museum. Most people don't even think of this museum as being a place to go. It has some really cool exhibits that come through. The Titanic, The Tony Hawk exhibit, The Lincoln exhibit, and Star Wars. Some really neat stuff. The building is beautiful too. I also love the craft show every year. Some really cool vendors. The IMAX theatre is awesome too. They have music on the canal too. I am always amazed how much is offered here.

I took my husband here and we were nothing but amazed!! All the history and exhibits are so well put together and intriguing!! We were there for no less than 3 hours and were never bored. This is a really amazing history packed adventure that will leave you in awe!!

We've photographed countless events for and at the Indiana State Museum. We still find it amazing our state has a museum that is this SENSATIONAL. The architecture of this museum is amazing...modern yet intermixed with some historical facades that we're lucky have been preserved. It is in the heart of the museum campus along the canal which make it a perfect location for images. And...who wouldn't want to dine around an original Robert Indiana Sculpture!? Wow.
Great place to take the kids!  Ended up buying a membership!  People don't like going downtown because parking is very expensive but with a membership its free! Huge bonus!

I love the State Museum. Most people don't even think of this museum as being a place to go. It has some really cool exhibits that come through. The Titanic, The Tony Hawk exhibit, The Lincoln exhibit, and Star Wars. Some really neat stuff. The building is beautiful too. I also love the craft show every year. Some really cool vendors. The IMAX theatre is awesome too. They have music on the canal too. I am always amazed how much is offered here.

We go here every year.

Check itabout you will learn a lot.
Nice variety of eras and styles of miniature doll houses. The museum is packed full of very detailed items that are worthy of being considered pieces of art.
$10.00 charge to visit.  Only ok.  Couldn't view all due to a meeting in progress blocking some displays.
The museum of minitures is one if the biggest adventures you can explore! Beyond awesome!

Loved it! 😊 Kid friendly (with supervision). I visited with my daughter and granddaughter, who is five years old. She was given a clipboard "treasure hunt" to fill out while I perused the collection and wallowed in forgotten childhood dreams. At the end of our experience she turned the finished sheet in for a prize and we chose some miniatures, carpets and wallpapers from the museum store to begin her own dollshouse. A wonderful experience.

This is a small but quality fire fighting museum.  Many different aspects from trucks, hoses, pumps, nozzles, pictures, badges and toys.  It is also an Indy museum as all memorabilia is from Indy stations.
Very fun and engaging. Team was wonderful!!
Nice place to hold an event, but that feeding the meter..sucked!  Come on Mass. Ave do better! (Please)

The museum is a trove of information and the lovely retired firefighter who was gracious enough to give us a tour was knowledgeable as well as a great story teller. I have unfortunately forgotten his name, but I am so grateful for the experience.
Cool piece of IFD historic

I've been twice. the first time was a few years ago and it was really informative and interesting. The guide  offered insight into how the asylum was run and a lot of history. The current tour had a lot less information provided thru the tour, but still a good time and I would recommend stopping by. the area on the grounds of the former Central State is really being built up and there's a coffee shop nearby.

Oldest pathology building still standing in US (second oldest overall). Interesting brain specimens with tumors and other pathologies from people in the nearby hospital for insanity. It is a guided tour with more general information,  rather than specific advances made by the doctors that worked there. If you have a science background its interesting to see how much and how little has changed (which could have made the tour more interesting to touch on i.e the machine they used to slice small sections in wax for closer exam is very similar to what is used for frozen sections from samples during surgery)
One of the coolest museums I've ever been to, but I'm entering the pathology field, so I may be biased. Very unique and a lot of U.S history here. Definitely worth seeing if you're in the area.
This was such a cool place to visit.  Tour guide was great.  We will definitely be back for another tour.

Awesome museum with a ton of history. Well preserved items, great price, super educational.

Tours happen on the hour, but make sure you’re there a bit early. Groups of 12 are brought in, if the group is full you’ll have to wait another hour.

The Eiteljorg is a great museum experience. I particularly liked how the museum was set up in different sections, focusing on both history and aesthetic: the main level is art work that features Native Americans and the American West in the artwork itself, whether that artwork be from Native Americans or Americans of European decent. The second level transitions from being an art museum to a history museum, focused largely on the Native American tribes of Indiana and the region in general, but then transitions back to more of a focus on art, but art from the perspective of the Native American nations that were creating it. Finally, in the basement is a kid's museum, with interactive exhibits and a themed play area. There is also a rotating gallery on the main level - on our visit it featured contemporary Native American artwork. The cafe was surprisingly good, offering up familiar choices with a Southwestern and Mexican influence.

Wonderful museum. Gorgeous works of art, and pieces both from actual Native Americans and from artists commemorating the old American West. Everything was presented in an incredibly respectful manner, and it was clear the museum employs and works with actual Native Americans to ensure pieces are presented in a respectful and accurate manner, rather than just as an old roadside oddity as has often been done in our nation's history. Overall this was a delightful and educational way to spend the afternoon.

Absolutely fantastic museum - we spent a few hours there and still didn't get to see quite everything that we wanted to. Gorgeous paintings downstairs, but I would recommend starting with all the artwork upstairs (made by Native Americans and providing that authentic perspective). A few paintings moved me to tears, and many more were simply awe-inspiring. Definitely an experience I'll remember.

We were attracted to the Eitejorg Museum by an advertisement we saw for their holiday train exhibit. What a wonderful surprise we got when we arrived. The museum is easily accessed by a underground parking garage. Once you go into the museum, it is clean, airy and the staff are friendly and professional. There is a great area that plays a wonderful tribute to western movies. The train exhibit was breathtaking. The art was so nice to look at with so many different exhibits that there is something for every person to enjoy. There is a really nice restaurant at the museum also. We will return.

Some of the most beautiful paintings and sculptures I have seen in my life.

Such a low cost to visit for some of the best western art in Indiana, arguably the Midwest.

Their exhibition on spaghetti westerns and the Christmas train exhibit were both worth the visit in themselves.

This is one of my favorite museums in Indiana, always try to come back when they get a new exhibit.

We have visited art museums across the US and this was my favorite. Easy access and plenty of parking. So many works by famous painters. There were so many hidden treats that I would happily return again. Nice layout and several seats to sit and enjoy the works. Escalators and elevators are conveniently located with police watching the parking lot.

I am planning an event at New Fields and I called to ask a few questions. Payton was super sweet and answered all my questions! I appreciate good customer service like this, thank you!
Also, the last time I was here Dru was so nice and stopped to see if our group was doing okay. I absolutely love this place!

Great art museum. Not too expensive. Easy casual day of enjoying art!

When we were there they had special exhibits of blown glass interior design that we found especially interesting. It was neat to see furniture and gadgets from 1900 till modern times.
Also, the grounds are pretty interesting and we toured the original mansion house. Nice day.

Mom and I enjoy this art museum. We try and always take the 1pm tour. It helps to learn something new. This Saturday it was on modern art and design and how they intersect.  Great leader.  Also the orchids were displayed every where giving the museum a spring feel.

Newfields is an awesome complex of the Indianapolis Museum of Art, the Lilly House, beautiful gardens and a nature park. What a wonderful place to have in your city. The art museum is absolutely fantastic--be sure to check out the JMW Turner pencil sketches if they are on display. We visited on a rainy day, and still thoroughly enjoyed the gardens.

Very clean. Friendly staff very nice layout. Was there for company meeting and banquet. Food was excellent meeting area comfortable with easy access for both direction of hall and stage. Spacious dining area in large foyer with grand design. Bar was staffed clean and organized with knowledgeable helpful staff.
This place is awesome the colts exhibit is pretty cool. The live action back in time exhibits are cool as well. Almost makes you feel like you did travel back in time.

My first time going today and I had a blast!  I loved the immersive time travel!  Probably one of the coolest and innovative things I've ever seen at a museum.  Such a cool way to learn about our history, with the most cutting-edge technology.

This is a very neat place to visit downtown. I went for the Festival of Trees and it was a really cool event and would highly recommend it during the Holiday Season. They had 80 uniquely different trees with each having there own them. They also have a Colts museum along with various other museums and things to do there. Again, I would highly recommend a visit if you are downtown.

This is a beautiful building located in the downtown area. The space is large enough to host an office Xmas party or function. At the moment they are having a beautiful Xmas display of Xmas trees.  If you have some spare time I suggest you go the admission is very reasonable.  I took off a star b/c it wasn't very visible from the street.

Cool place for college sports buffs. Lots of fun history behind how the NCAa began and each of the currently recognized sports. Also highlighted how women's sports began to enter the field in the college realms as well. You could spend about an hour here and get a quick snapshot or really soak in all the knowledge in about half a day. Fun activities for kids and adults who like to be kids too!

I've been here twice now as a teacher with our 8th grade students on a field trip. It's been fun and enjoyable for the kids both times. The staff are friendly and helpful. You can tell they are big college sports fans, and they know a lot of history. There's an 8 minute video you can watch about the origins of the NCAA, and then there are interactive displays of all the official sports with information about them on the first floor. Upstairs, there is a small basketball court that demonstrates how the sport has changed through the years. There are also a few other interactive exhibits upstairs. There are two Candy Crush touchscreen games, a thing where you can test your vertical leap, and two areas where you take shots on the goal for soccer with a game. Good time!

To me personally, this isn't a very exciting place. However, my 11 and 8 year old sons love it! They're huge sports trivia nerds. We spent a few hours and they weren't ready to go. I did like the movie about Pres. Roosevelt and the history of NCAA. Also, the staff was amazing with the kids. So friendly and outgoing.

I attended my boyfriend's work holiday party here. Appetizers were good. The beer and wine was moderately price. We were severed, salad, bread, main course, and dessert. The food was much better than I had expected being a catered event. I was pleasantly surprised.
We thought the first floor was fun and interesting and then we got to the second floor, which was even better.  So many interactive exhibits!  We learned a lot and had a great time!

I hosted an event at the Indianapolis Art Center for a prominent health institute and received the best treatment by the staff and facility. 80+ chairs were set up in the library space with an AV system for the keynote speaker. The windows and skylight letting in nature and light were part of a beautiful ambiance. All the staff and namely Brylie and Abby are very professional, friendly, and accommodating. Ample and accessible parking. Plus, supporting the IAC felt great. Thank you —I’ll be back!
Loving a woodworking class here. The shop is so well equipped and our teacher is wonderful. The building and grounds are beautiful. Stop by sometime and walk around. You’ll be impressed.

The Indianapolis Art Center is an incredible asset to the community that delivers such remarkable benefit! Our non-profit is so grateful to have been able to rent this wonderful space. The atmosphere, communication, and contact with the IAC for our free positive parenting event was exemplary; and the provided equipment was wonderfully helpful. The space was set up and ready to go when we arrived and it was generally the easiest, most fluid part of organizing and hosting an event. We feel lucky to have such an asset in the area for places like ourselves to host events and engage with our community members. Thank you, IAC!

The Indianapolis Art Center hosted a fantastic team building event for our group. Couldn't have been happier with the whole process. Great opportunity for our colleagues to connect with each other, and the classes were all very well delivered and received.

We have hosted our company holiday party at the Indianapolis Art Center for many years. The staff is a delight and the accommodations are perfect for our group. Always happy to return to the Indianapolis Art Center!
Great open house event. Saw many galleries and ran into an old artist friend who has a studio there. Historic and be sure to check out the cars!
Annual open house is worth a visit whether your interest is art or socializing.
We went durring sn open house. They had several artist there showin off thier work with small snacks and drinks everywhere. Art just isnt for me though
Graduates of Herron are good people to hire. They work passionately and think outside the box.

despite its recent construction (2005) almost none of the water fountains worked and took 3 years to be fixed. pencil sharpeners are broken in every classroom and no one does anything about it. you have to wonder what the staff is thinking... secretly a communist cult run by childless, ultra bitter women and the "men" whom supplicate them, this place is Satan's vision for a dystopian future. 
if you are attractive you are the enemy and will draw disdain from beta male teachers half of whom are instantly at odds. 
women here are aggressive, violent, cuss like sailors, and seem eager to falsely accuse someone of rape, steer clear like I did and don't take any risks with these monsters. like vampirism they are brainwashed by older staff members into not having kids only to end up evil old witches whom pass it on. what's left of the women will be excluded from the social group for being pretty, not that many of them are in much better shape (damaged from having no dad at home after being raised by single moms).
if you are heterosexual and attractive prepare yourself for unwanted sexual implications/advances. 
staff standards are loosely based upon not being of European descent or a masculine male. incompetent teachers fill the void by dumping their personal politics on you for an hour and a half. although, some teachers here were superb, such as Earl (in Drawing), Mark (Comics and Graphic Novels), and Jeff (in Photo) and I really was educated by them. it's a shame because I bet this place was amazing back in decades past (at its previous location). providing context I voted for Obama twice and didn't vote for Trump and am not Christian nor religious and I was still not thrilled to be here. if you want to discover why there has never been a successful matriarchy on Earth, look no further (serious masochists only).
Amazing!!
I have fond memories of going here. The facilities and staff are superb!
also slang for heroin

I've been twice. the first time was a few years ago and it was really informative and interesting. The guide  offered insight into how the asylum was run and a lot of history. The current tour had a lot less information provided thru the tour, but still a good time and I would recommend stopping by. the area on the grounds of the former Central State is really being built up and there's a coffee shop nearby.

Oldest pathology building still standing in US (second oldest overall). Interesting brain specimens with tumors and other pathologies from people in the nearby hospital for insanity. It is a guided tour with more general information,  rather than specific advances made by the doctors that worked there. If you have a science background its interesting to see how much and how little has changed (which could have made the tour more interesting to touch on i.e the machine they used to slice small sections in wax for closer exam is very similar to what is used for frozen sections from samples during surgery)
One of the coolest museums I've ever been to, but I'm entering the pathology field, so I may be biased. Very unique and a lot of U.S history here. Definitely worth seeing if you're in the area.
This was such a cool place to visit.  Tour guide was great.  We will definitely be back for another tour.

Awesome museum with a ton of history. Well preserved items, great price, super educational.

Tours happen on the hour, but make sure you’re there a bit early. Groups of 12 are brought in, if the group is full you’ll have to wait another hour.

Products are very expressive even with a value card. I could just go down valley and get a better affordable price. However, the major flaw with Aspen city market is the employees and how terrible they are trained. The problem must be the management because else who trains the employees? If the employees performance lacks due to poor training, and the manager trains the employees; therefore, the managers are not training the employees correctly. I have heard criticism that the HR's treat them poorly and unjustly. Even heard that they guilt trip their employees. Who does that? I love shopping at City market for quick pick ups, but u can't help to find myself seeing managers mistreating these employees. As a result, the employees underperform and creates aisle clogs. Don't get me wrong I do not like to acknowledge the "behind the scenes" of management, but if this is management then there is something wrong with Aspen's city market.
Nice market right in the middle of town. Isle ways are a little tight but staff was very helpful. Great selections and a perfect deli. A must stop if you’re in town for a while and need groceries.

Small location but solid selection. The prices are reasonable and City Market doesn't spike up the prices just because it's located in Aspen. Only complaints is that because it is small is that it's usually always crowded, although the lines move pretty fast. Store seems a little outdated too if you pay attention to the flooring and shelving.
Quick, had a good selection, including a fast n reasonable ready to eat dinner takeout option.
Very nice people,  reasonable prices.  Good selection

One of the best and cheapest breakfast places in Indy.  The Donut Shop is a local business that has been around for decades, and it hasn't changed much that entire time.  The donuts are delicious and they have plenty of breakfast and lunch options.  The food is always good and inexpensive.  Service is always consistent.  This place has been a staple my whole life.
Their donuts are the besttttt! It really shows a symbol that they are doing their best to make their donuts flavorful and beautiful too. It’s appreciated and I recommend you visit this Donut shop
We had the chocolate and the honey glazed. Both were so soft and delicious. Will definitely return
Great diner type experience. Good old fashioned breakfast. Great prices. Just remember to bring cash. They don't except cards.
If on donuts alone, it'd be 5 stars. But the food is OK and the coffee was a little worse. Still, cheap food and quick service.

Longtime favorite. Never have found another place that steams bagels this way! Everything here is amazing! Service and food! They have awesome homemade marshmallow, nut, and potato stick yummy bars by the register...they are to die for! 😍

I have such fondness for this place! This is our go-to Sunday morning as we meander towards downtown for Sunday-Funday. It's counter service, usually packed and there are no lines. You step up to the counter when you're ready and stay well back and out of the way if you're not. The staff isn't rude, just efficient. They yell over the crowds, they use few words, they get it done!

The bagels themselves aren't anything super special, (I'm from the northeast U.S. originally) but it's what they put on them!! Morning Mess is my absolute favorite, but the variety just blows your mind. They've been creative and thoughtful in what they craft. They always come out scalding hot and delicious.

I love coming to the deli as a customer and I love ordering catering for my office! The catering is always delicious and always a hit! Some of the men were skeptical of not being full but they were pleasantly surprised and have looked forward to Bagel Deli catering every time I order it! From the breakfast casseroles, to breakfast sandwiches and the yogurt with granola and fresh fruit - Bagel Deli has always exceeded expectations!

First time in the restaurant,  customer service was amazing , and it reminded me of home , NYC food was on point and fulling sandwich is packed with meat and topping. I for sure will be returning. My husband loved the Indy 500 Bagel.
These are some of the best sandwiches in the city. The staff is always friendly and funny. They will also throw together whatever you request.

Ordered bacon on my sandwich and it was RAW and uncooked. The hambuger patty was about the thickness of a nickel. I fly in and out of Indy 5 times per year and will NEVER eat here again. Warning don't do eat there.

What happened to this place??? As others stated, I too waited forever for what ended up being cold food. On top of that the food wasn’t very good. It is so sad to see this place fall from where they were, it used to be so delicious.

The wait was long, but that was due to the employees cooking a fresh batch of burgers to order. However, the cheese steak burger was less than impressive. It was almost McDonald's level quality but at higher airport prices. 

I made the mistake of ordering my burger "mustard style," which was supposed to mean that the bun was grilled with mustard. Translation: Your burger will be absolutely slathered in yellow mustard.

I've actually never gotten the chance to actually eat here as 1) The first time there was couple of people ahead of me & then I waited literally 10 minutes at the register. There was one person who even seemed like he knew what he was doing & he was literally showing everyone else how to do their job. 2) I decided to give them one last chance - no line, yay! I waited 5 minutes & noone came out. So I left yet again. I purposely left early to try this place & I never will again.

Apparently they were backed up on orders, so they told everyone that they were NOT taking anymore orders.
NOT a good thing for business in my opinion! I mean they closed at 5:45 during high airport hours and  - would not recommend!

This is not the most glorious spot, but they do a couple things well...
The customer service is impeccable. The nice woman who made my food asked how i wanted everything I ordered. The prices are AMAZING (nice and cheap). They make basic food but they are also open late.
The best greasy spoon in Indianapolis!  Great hamburgs and biscuits n' gravy.  Reasonable pricing, terrific staff.  THE BEST GEM IN INDY!  I come for a great place to have coffee too.

One of the cooks was touching all the food and preparing food without gloves on.  The other cook used gloves.  Also, while sitting at my booth I killed a cockroach that was crawling across that dividing wall from the booths/kitchen area. Won't be back for a very long time.
My favorite neighborhood quick bite shop. Everything is always made to order. The staff is always on point. It really does feel like home.
I loved this place! But its closed now.. Health code violations? :(
We stopped in for a couple of gallons of their rich and creamy root beer.   It did not disappoint.  The next trip will include some of the always tasty food at Indy's finest drive inn.

Mug-n-Bun is just an Indianapolis classic you just can't avoid. Something just draws you to it every year when it gets warmer and the sun comes out. The pork tenderloin is just fabulous and juicy and tender. And the onion rings, Oh, the onion rings...if I could ever bring myself to NOT order a tenderloin, I would like to order a family size of onion rings and just eat those! They are THAT delicious. If you're an out of Towner, please find your way to Mug-n-Bun. You will not regret it!

The best midwest "sin food drive in EVER. PERIOD. 

Tons of yummy food options and some of the "best" available vanilla flavored homemade root beer on tap . 

A family vacation led us here twice in 2 separate vacations , and the food is still awesome. WORTH EVERY PENNY , no matter how little or how much you get any particular day!
My eyes were bigger than my stomach. The food was really good. The onion rings were gigantic and delicious. And their homemade root beer was unique. I liked it.
Food is great tasting.. when they say it's not what's on the outside that counts but the inside. They truly have hit this on the head. Good people Great fast food etc

This is not the most glorious spot, but they do a couple things well...
The customer service is impeccable. The nice woman who made my food asked how i wanted everything I ordered. The prices are AMAZING (nice and cheap). They make basic food but they are also open late.
The best greasy spoon in Indianapolis!  Great hamburgs and biscuits n' gravy.  Reasonable pricing, terrific staff.  THE BEST GEM IN INDY!  I come for a great place to have coffee too.

One of the cooks was touching all the food and preparing food without gloves on.  The other cook used gloves.  Also, while sitting at my booth I killed a cockroach that was crawling across that dividing wall from the booths/kitchen area. Won't be back for a very long time.
My favorite neighborhood quick bite shop. Everything is always made to order. The staff is always on point. It really does feel like home.
I loved this place! But its closed now.. Health code violations? :(

On our visit to Bosphorus, we were served by the owner of the establishment, who is SUPER friendly and went above and beyond to suite our needs! Felt like we were actually IN Turkey! Atmosphere is great, food was delicious, and everything tasted so fresh and authentic. Would DEFINITELY recommend this place. Truly a "hidden gem" of Indianapolis.
I would give more stars if I could. Food is more than fantastic. Exceptional service. Wonderfully warm ambiance. Will be frequenting to try more of their delicious menu.

Extremely clean. Nice decor with white linen tablecloths. Friendly owner. All food made to order so wait time is longer than the norm but we'll worth it. Food was impeccable. I had zucchini pancakes for appetizer and the lunch special with lentil soup and chicken mediterean and baklava all for $10.50. Great value for food quality and portion sizes. I will definitely be back!!! What a gem!!
You could not go wrong coming to this establishment. The staff are incredible and the food only matches. This has been more than just a casual dinner, it was an experience. Well worth the stay.
Best experience I've had in years! SUPER friendly staff, and SUPER delicious food. Definitely the best place to go if you're in Indianapolis. Simply AMAZING!

Delicious food and excellent service! Tonight was our first experience eating Indian cuisine. Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly with his recommendations and my husband and I both truly enjoyed our experiences.  We would recommend this restaurant to friends and family, and we will definitely be coming back ourselves.
This place was great. We ordered Lamb chops and chicken masala? (The first menu in curry categories) and they were nice. We will visit there again definitely.
The food is amazing and the wait staff so friendly. Every time we are in Ann Arbor we eat there as no other Indian restaurant is as good. We've been eating there for 20 years.

One of the best Indian restaurants I've eaten at and I have been eating there for years. Reminds me of the nicer Indian restaurants in Great Brittan where I first tried Indian food. Authentic food served in a very nice atmosphere. The waiters are all very professional and efficient. I asked about a dish I used to order but was not on the menu now and the waiter said they would make it for me... Chicken Hyderabadi (not sure I spelled that right) delicious! I'll back when I'm in town again.

The food is delicious in every word possible! I went with my mom, and she's usually picky when it comes to food, but she absolutely loved their food. Our waiter was the best! The prices are not that bad. The service was good, a man in a suit (I believe the owner) came to our to check up on us. All in all, it was a great first experience.

Maybe I caught them on a bad day. My food was horrible. Spring rolls were the worst I've ever had. My noodles were cooked in burnt sesame oil. My Sesame chicken was not chewable and absolutely disgusting. I should have brought the whole $27.00 meal, including a 20% tip BACK. Also I waited for over 35 minutes for this. My local restaurant in Florida takes the usual 15 Minutes. Good luck trying this Family owned cafe that's been there 13 years? My dinner went in the garbage. 😣
Our go to Chinese restaurant.  Always good hot food.  Orders always right and quick.  Friendly staff.  Highly recommend.
Best chinese take out Ive had. We order here like twice a month. Love their crab ragoons.
Great food. Best in the Moorseville and camby area .
Food always fresh and staff friend
Awesome.  I have wanted to try this place for years. I always heard good things. Definitely worth the time. Great pizza and service.

My family and I was in Indianapolis and decided to try out a local restaurant and we're so glad we did!!! The food was absolutely delicious!!! It was five of us in our party and everyone ordered a 10 inch with their own toppings. I had the sausage and pepperoni but everyone one of the pizzas looked good!!! The staff was great too!!! I will most definitely be stopping there again!!!
It was on of the best pizzas I have had in the US!! It was really good. I strongly recommend this place! 👍

Was not impressed. Very basic tasting and the pepperoni smelled as if they were soaked in dirty dish water. Crust was overly doughy. Service was good and quick but my disappointment in the pizza stands tall. A little Cesar's $5 large is better tasting.
Great pizza and experience. Just a super long wait. Next time I go I would get reservations.

Absolutely wonderful!!! Love the owners and atmosphere!!! Food was spectacular!! Very rarely do i go out to eat & i will definitely make it a point to eat here with my family or just me and my husband.... Thank you for a wonderful dinner!!!

This place is AMAZING. Anna has taken great care to always make it beautiful and welcoming with beautiful fresh flowers every time we have been there. She pampers us with complimentary new things to try. We always go here for special occasions and birthdays because we are never disappointed in the quality or freshness of the food. Thank you guys!!! So blessed to have you in Anacortes.
Absolutely delicious. Amazing all around, and finally found good baklava!
Had the special, Greek Ribs. AMAZING!  Excellent food, family run, authentic.
Yummy food!  Generous portions!  Friendly staff!

Very friendly staff and amazingly delicious food. Not the cheapest, but entirely worth it - I highly recommend the side salad with blue cheese dressing (made in house!). The tortellini is astounding and worth the visit. A great family friendly experience or a tasty bar - definitely worth it whenever you're feeling up for Italian.
What an awesome restaurant. Full of history. All items are freshly made in house. Great lunch with good service. Well worth finding this local gem and trying.

Been going here since a child. All homemade food, including most pastas, sauces and salad dressing. The scene itself is out of 1950. Always super friendly AND attentive staff. Not a bad dish. Also, bring a mega appetite. And Indy requisite.
Still amazing after all these years. Has such a high table turnover for the volume that comes in there. Atmosphere still wonderful. Thanks for all the happy memories.
Been going to this place for a long long time!  Never had anything there that I didn't love. An absolute staple in Indy for Italian. If you don't know, you better ask somebody!

Amazing restaurant with probably some of the best Ethiopian food I have ever had. The ambiance is okay (not my taste), the location is not great, but the food and coffee are excellent. Great place to order large platter with friends or family and try out a variety of dishes. Unlimited Injera (bread), and they will bring out delicious spicy sauces if you ask for it. Courteous and fast servers. My favorite place for Ethiopian food in Indy, and even though it is very far away from my house, I can't stop driving here to get food!

Simply amazing. Had the vegetarian combo plate for four, and every single dish on the plate was killer. The coffee ceremony is a must. The staff were super nice and helpful. The decor is beautiful and the ambiance is very fitting, with Ethiopian & Eritrean music playing over the speakers and frankincense thick in the air. Definitely some of the best Ethiopian food I've ever had.
Was so amazing. Gluten free food. If you want the gluten free bread you need to call ahead. Recommend the coffee ceremony.
Amazing food. So flavorful. This was my first time here and eathing Ethiopian food. It will not be my last. I would recommend to anyone wanting to try something different and healthy.
Great customer service! Great atmosphere! Great food! Probably my favorite Ethiopian restaurant in the city. We come here weekly

The ambiance is sophisticated and festive. The servers are professional and knowledgeable, attentive without hovering. The food is incredible. I haven't eaten here for a few years, so I was delighted to find new dishes on the menu. My meal was perfectly seasoned and plated. I will eat here again!

Very romantic place for a random husband and wife date night. Our server was very knowledgeable and on top of his game. The food was amazing, we had an absolutely lovely time! Would def go back again to this location.

This restaurant greets you as an old friend.  Friendly, happy to answer any questions and polite.  Amanda was our waitress.  She was just perfect.  She anticipated our needs and was very attentive.   The food is out of this world.  From the stuffed mushrooms to the filet with caramelized scallops, the dining experience is the best. We will be back every time we visit our children.

To

Just enjoyed a wonderful meal with my girlfriend for a late valentines dinner. Our server Antonio had excellent recommendations for whiskey and food! Great place to go for a nice meal without totally breaking the bank! Thanks Antonio!

PHENOMENAL!!!

Scallops were incredible. Highly recommend! Request Matthew as your server, best service I have received in a long time.
Best fish fry in Indianapolis! I've been going here since I was just a kid and 10/10 highly recommend. Great people work and run this place.

Support local! This is a great restaurant with a rich history in Wanamaker. I applaud the current owners for keeping this alive and opening it up more hours. Best fish fry around and I love their biscuits and gravy. You can't go wrong with this place. It is the ultimate in comfort food.
Best fish I've had in a long time! Customer service is awesome so friendly here. Will definitely return.

We came here for fried chicken, forgot they serve that on Sundays only. The fish dinner was better than the last time I was here, more lightly breaded and not fried hard-- very tasty! Big portions, too. The breakfasts are very good, also: Their biscuits & gravy are closest to Southern style of anyplace in Indy.
Pretty good tenderloin. The fish was good, too. Clean dining area. Only complaint was the fries, which were bland.

Great food and atmosphere. From the cooks, to the servers, to the owners. Everything was delicious, quick, and affordable. I had the border omelette and it was pretty amazing. Chatted with the owners a little and they really take a lot of pride, as they should, in running this terrific cafe. THIS is where the locals really go to hang out, socialize, and eat some fantastic food!

Great brunch spot! Amazing food, wonderful staff and atmosphere. Gina and Tom are the kindest owners and truly care about you and your experience. This place has became a regular spot for my girlfriend and I and we have yet to have anything other than an exceptional experience!
I loved the cinnamon french toast I had gotten. The service was amazing. Their is even cool looking art you can buy. I highly recommend for the appetizer the fried biscuits.

The food was cooked well, but I didn't think the menu items were that unique as suggested by other reviews. Only one item seemed unique, which was the Aloha Benedict that I had to try and I thought tasted good. Other than that this diner is no different than other places and is a little bit over priced for the portions and quality. Also the potatoes were a little dry. They definitely need more menu options too. Liked that this place wasn't a chain, but didn't think there was anything special about it compared to other breakfast restaurants.

An OK place. Nothing special. Basic breakfast food. Ordered eggs over medium. Eggs were undercooked, egg white and yoke runny. Turkey sausage was salty. Not very busy, so we were served quickly. Server was efficient and friendly. However, only 3 tables occupied, and one guy sitting at the counter. 8:00 am in the morning.

Food:
Food quality is good and taste is also okay (definitely not the best!).
Nevertheless, prices are bit higher comparing to other local restaurants.

Environment:
One of the nicest eatery of Chittagong city in terms of interior decoration. They have sufficient space and setting is quite good.
You won't be bothered with loud noises.
Again, stuffs are well behaved.

Location:
Situation at city's commercial hub, Agrabad. Therefore easily accessible.
Lovely place. It has a very beautiful environment. The staff's behaviour is very polite. Food quality is great.

Very good quality foods...great restaurant to held some party....like wedding.birthday.seminar.etc.
Waiters have very good behavior...
I have ordered Chinese food.chinese food was so good
There service is very good...
There food quality is great
It is nice restaurant. Buffett available here . Anybody choose it for his personal or family program. It's service quick and all the buddies are cordial.
Nice place to have good & testy food. Quality of food & service is very good. We have a conference in their. It was a good experience about the restaurant.
Great food and ambience, was a little loud for a conversation but overall it was a great place to dine
Great Fish and chips. Good pub atmosphere. Reasonable prices
Good drink options, great location, and perhaps the best fried cod I've ever eaten.
good spot, esp for locals but only 1 pool table
Great food and atmosphere. Service is top-notch. Whether going to Banker's for sports or watching them at the bar, you can't beat O'Reilly's.
PLEASE GET COFFEE. Dessert is not dessert without a cup of black coffee. Otherwise, great food. Very knowledgeable and accommodating staff. They have a wonderful set up for a larger group.

Small independent restaurant where you can dine with friends or share a longer table with other diners. They make a fabulous hamburger for lunch and menu is diverse but not extensive. One negative for me, is chef doesn't like to substitute sides. Great place to try something new! Black Market has some of the best, innovative food in Indianapolis while being wholly accessible to a wide variety of tastes.

You will be delighted as soon as you walk in the door.  We were quickly greeted and given the option of a seat at a private table or a communal table. The food was excellent with great service. Cozy atmosphere.  Simply put, an upscale restaurant experience at a good price (non upscale price).

Irish pub on steroids. Great selection of Irish Whiskeys and great pub fare. Super packed downstairs bar but everybody was friendly, bartenders were busy but friendly and highly skilled.

Had a Tipperary (classic) which was Terrific. So was the Irish Coffee

Black Market has been reinvigorated by new chef Esteban Rosas, who has transformed the food menu into somthing quite special. The new spring menu is full of bright colors and flavors, the roasted trout is a must try. The Octopus is super tender and perfectly cooked. Don't forget Wednesdays are half price bottles of wine!!!

My wife and I took our three kids here for a Friday dinner after a long day at the children's museum. We we're so happy we did! I had the fish-n-chips and it was the best I have ever had. My wife had a salad and a soup and my kids all had kid meals. Everyone of us cleaned our plates, which is rare for my family. We we're delightfully impredded with the food. Portion sizes are just right and we ended up doing dessert too and had a fresh baked cookie with Guinness ice cream.

We will definitely go here again when we are in town. We had previously gone to the Weber Grill restaurant. This little pub had better food and our bill was half the cost.

Very good experience.  Everyone at our table thoroughly enjoyed their meal selections.  Good beers on tap.  Went back later in the evening.  Very good band playing in the evening.  Great.fun atmosphere.

It's been awhile since I've been here. The food has taken a dramatic downward slope. The service is nonexistent. Not horrible but far from good. Saw the waiter when I was seated when I got my good and when I got my check. Heard him often cussing and complaining about his apartment in the background. Won't be back.

I love this place. Good food and good service. My two favorites: Fish and Chips and Shepherd's Pie. Cheese and Sausage Boards great too.
.
Went here to celebrate St. Patty's day. Had some good food and listened to some music. The service was amazing for how busy they were! My friends and I had fun here!

If you are looking for Indian food near monument circle in Indianapolis then this is the best place. Ambience is good. They serve traditional North Indian food with drinks. Not so crowded, spacious and easily accessible. Overall good experience with this restaurant.

Been eating my way around Indy 2yrs now and this is without question the BEST place around. 

Food: Unbeatable. Absolutely stellar.  Whether you're a carnivore, vegetarian, vegan or otherwise, there are delicious options for all.  

Staff: Their courtesy and friendliness is only outdone by their genuine interest in giving you an ideal dining experience.  

Price: Very fair.  

Highly recommend.
Had lunch there today with my office. First time there. We all had the buffet. All left stuffed. Lots of goodness on the buffet. Restaurant was very clean and staff extra friendly.

Oh my goodness this treasure is so worth getting out in the snow to dine inside! The lunch buffet was everything I needed! The only thing that could have made this meal better was parking, but they can't control the city meters. Definitely plan out parking when you come and give yourself time to enjoy the buffet. A lunch hour doesn't do it justice!

Not authentic Indian food. It is how majority of the "Indian" restaurants have become in America, trying to adjust their food according to the "American" crowds taste(sweet, not spicy and dull) and in the process they are no longer serving Indian food.

Owner has not taken any steps to make his food Indian. Infact the food has got more and more sugar added to it since my last review. You don't feel like eating dessert by end of the meal cause you are already high on sugar.

Nice place for breakfast or brunch (they don't do dinner and lunch anyway). It could take some time to get a sit here because this place is very popular. The service is helpful and the orders get quick. the food is good with nice variety of sweet and savory with reasonable price. the place itself is cozy and the acoustic is good enough that you can hear one another at your table. They did some renovations lately in early 2019.
First time here.  Delicious food and great atmosphere!  Got the carrot cake pancakes as it was their monthly pancake special - very hearty but tasted great!

We go there quite often for breakfast or brunch. The food is good without being excellent. The portion are large, the staff is agreeable and everything is well-priced. Be careful, there will be a line on weekends!
Love this upscale cafe little place. Great food and service, good atmosphere, can't wait to get back and try another item.

Amazing place with friendly and attentive staff. Breakkie is divine. You have to see for yourself. Very relaxed atmosphere. One star less as this place doesn't offer WiFi. A bit rude to bring the bill before I have finished eating.. Suggests they want you to finish ASAP and get the hell out of there.
Good stuff. Menu is diverse, food always tastes and looks good, and I love the atmosphere. They have a pretty sick coffee bar, seem to be serving Tinker most often. Totally worth a wait to be seated.

This place is worth the wait! We came on a Saturday around 12 and they said it would be a 30 minute wait. We bought bloody Mary’s and coffees and stayed outside. The Bloody Mary was flavorful and you have to get it with the charcuterie stick and beer back! The espresso was strong and delicious too! Our wait was only around 10 minutes. We ate at the counter and that was awesome. It is an open kitchen, which was cool. We started with some oysters. That hot sauce mignonette had a great acid note and paired perfectly with the oysters.

A.M.A.Z.I.N.G! A lot of restaurants now a days have food that tastes the same, seasoned with salt and pepper and cheese, but not Milktooth! I ordered a variety of food and it was all amazing. I LOVE the taste of curry and they have a biscuit with curry butter that blew my mind. And the coffee.. 😍 YUM I wish I lived close because I would go all the time!

We came here for brunch on a Saturday morning and it was crowded so we had to wait. As we were waiting, we got our coffee (there coffee is great) and before we could finish it we got our table and it was worth the wait. We ordered 3 items; potato latke, everything spice  fried new potatoes with sunny egg and grilled cauliflower and everything tasted good. 
The place has a nice vibe. Though we didn't try any of their pastries but it looked yummy.

Milktooth has become a must go dining destination with breakfast, lunch and bakery options which are unique, clever, well done and--most of all--great for foodies and anyone hungry or soon to be hungry. The feel is urban and edgy and yet the staff are attentive and helpful at every turn. Not to be missed in downtown Indy.

Food was outstanding and the service was top notch. Food portions were perfect and the price was as expected for the area.   The atmosphere was great. Made reservations and when I arrived I had no wait at all and was treated with top customer service.

I don’t know about how it looks like during the day, but during the night, the interior looks good . Definitely the place you want to go if you just want a low key date .

My friend had a reservation for her birthday. They personalized the menu for this  (They deserve 5 stars just for that ). 

The bald headed server is just the best . He brightened our night . He helped us choosing a drink and even customized our meals .

About the price , $30 won’t do 🥴 you need at least $60 to enjoy their foods and drink .

There’s a parking right in front of the restaurant. How convenient is that !

Poor customer service from management and server did not leave a good impression for my first visit. The server did not keep up with me and my party. I reserved table for my Birthday party and had to pay for the reservation but when half the party didn't show, the manager Nathan made us move to a small table to serve other customers (his words) a hour in. At this point we had been served water and wine and were waiting for our food. We waited another 30 minutes for bread to be brought to us only after we asked. Finally the bread came at the same time our food arrived🤦🏾‍♀️. After the dinner and waiting 20 minutes for our leftovers,  we got separate checks. I was scolded in the presence of my guests for asking why we all had to pay 17% per check for gratuity and a $5 fee per check for a large party. He rudely stated he did me a favor by not charging me $300 that we were short on the contract & we only spent $500 between 7 people. It was disrespectful so I emailed corporate and still no response from them three weeks later. 

The food was delicious but the service was not. I will not be return.

UPDATE:
As of today I still have not heard from the owner even though I emailed them including my phone number as requested.

Great service, awesome food. My first visit to this restaurant was to celebrate my birthday and the service and food was amazing. We were treated as kings. For your birthday, they printed a customized menu and each staff member signed a birthday card. They also offer a complimentary Alaskan Flambe ( I don't remember exactly the name). 
If there's something you are excited to try, ask your host if there's anything special that is not on the menu. We asked and got a fabulous grilled seafood plate (see photo). 
I will definitely recommend this place for anyone that wants to celebrate a special occasion or a date night.

Took my wife to the Oceanaire before the Pacers game.  The waiter we had was excellent.  It wasn't too busy as we had early reservations (515).  My wife's Salmon was cooked to perfection (well done for her).  I got the Red King Crab legs, which were excellent.  The service was 5 star also.  One of the top restaurants downtown.  We got an appetizer, two entrees (king crab was 65), one side and two sodas for $150. You get what you pay for and we will be back in the future.

My experience today wasn't pleasant. Waited 22 minutes on my sandwich to be brought to me (NY style Reuben) and my dining companion was already completely done with her meal. I would expect more expedient service when spending $50 at a deli for 2 people. 

But that's the last money I ever spend there. It gets great reviews, I just wish my experience was better

This place fits the bill for a Jewish deli. I have been going to places in Chicago and NY all my life. Shapiro’s stacks up against the best.

The pricing is definitely steep for IN as I think we had a $43 bill for two. However, I didn’t mind it. Personally, I would recommend the brisket on onion roll.

Awesome food!  Amazing dessert spread, my only regret was that I couldn't eat more.  The portions are huge.  The Reuben sandwich was excellent.  Staff was friendly and it didn't take long to get the food.

Great place to eat. I had the beef stew, deviled eggs and cheese cake and it was all great. My partner had the beef stew too and he loved it. He says the place is the same from when he would come here as a kid.

Treated my in-laws and they were incredibly impressed. Pastrami on marble rye for Pop, Mom had the corned beef on rye, my daughter wolfed down a Reuben. Mom also swore the potato pancakes were addictive, she had 3 of them. Really enjoyed the food.

Frequent flyer here, give this spot a try and you won't regret it. Lots of food
The lunch specials are phenomenal and the service is short and sweet. Call in for carryout, or dine in you will be well taken care of
Best of meat and heat! My beef and string beans were fantastic. If you're looking for quality Thai food, I would recommend this eatery.
I have no idea how to pronounce what I ate, but dear lord was it good. Super friendly staff, also. Definitely going back.
Very tasty food! I love it "Thai hot" - very very hot without ruining the flavors of food. Soups are delicious.

Great pick up service,  in and out in minutes.   Staff was helpful and friendly.   Blue crab sushi had a little too much rice but otherwise balanced taste.  The padd see ewe was spicy as desired, just lacking an amount of chicken with the dish.  Would recommend this place.

Been here several times and the food and service has gotten progressively worse. This last time was the last straw, both of the entrees we ordered were clearly reheated; the beef was tough and chewy, rice was borderline crunchy and they charged 3 dollars for an instant coffee. Better still, when we walked in, both the servers had a plate from the buffet a few doors down. That should have been my first hint to walk right back out. Those $60 spent there on Sunday weigh heavily on my conscious, we would have been much better off at that buffet.
Nice and delicious food, good prices and the best is that you don't have to wait long to be  helped

Came in atmosphere was very dull. No music was playing. Wasn’t greeted or acknowledged till about 10 minutes later. We had to sit ourselves and wait for the waitress who was in the back just chit chatting with the other waitresses and cooks. The restaurant is empty and quiet we should have been acknowledged immediately no excuse. Finally when we ordered the waitress was not enthusiastic at all carries a stank face was not paying attention and got both orders wrong. The employees are focused on the party going on in the kitchen instead of ensuring the satisfaction of their patrons and I say party in the kitchen because they have music back there but not or the customers!!!!

I'm Peruvian and always looking for new places to remind me of where I came from. The food was ok. Large portions are served. The only thing it lacked was the peruvian vive, music background and more options in the menu as well as professionalism of the servers.
I love the food. I've been several times over the past few years and it's always great. The service can be spotty, but the food is consistently great.

I have been wanting to check this place out for a long time! Plus the yelp event made me want to go even more!
Today I finally made the effort to head over and eat.
So glad I did! Everything about it was great.
The location is just fun, there is a couple of different entrances and you can seat yourself, I decided to sit on the bar side, it was quieter and I was able to take in everything. I’m not sure what this used to be, but my hat is off to the designer of the space.
The service is awesome! Attentive, but not stifling. 
I love bloody Mary’s, and try to have one to every place I go. The corner has a build your own Bloody Mary bar! You get a cup of ice with vodka, but then you get to take over from there, the mix is very fresh, but you can add hot sauce and all the fixings! It was amazing! 
Brunch food is some of the best food, I had the smoked salmon on toast with a poached egg. Can’t wait to go back and have more delicious food!

It's a very nice place located in pretty good area in Indy. It has a special wine selection and it offers good food options. 

I loved the fries and the empanadas! The day I went they had a band playing live music called Touch of Grass and it was awesome the way they interacted with the audience. 

All bartenders were great, in special CK!

Also, this place throws private events which they seem to have everything to make you have a nice time and not to worry about how your guests feel, they are in charge of your happiness.

If you go to Indy, it's a must place to visit!
The Corner is worth the wait. Great atmosphere, warm and personal service, and incredible food. The perfect spot for an evening with friends and a good bottle of wine. I can’t wait to go back!

Been there a few times. Service has been hit and miss, but much more hit than miss. Food is always excellent, though. Limited menu, but everything on there has been great. Definitely worth the stop for a good bite of food.
Very nice changes under new ownership.  Thursday Filet Mignon is $15.... And 1/2 price bottles of wine. Best deal in Indianapolis
Excellent all around. Great atmosphere, service was superb, the food was amazing - how ca some of the same dishes as elsewhere taste so much better here. A wonderful dining experience.

My wife and I recently visited Fleming's Steak & Wine Bar for our wedding anniversary. We both ordered the filet and it was superb! I was also amazed at how attentive they were with extra effort taken to make it a very special occasion! They treated us like absolute royalty! For this, I give a huge 5 star rating!
Fantastic dinner... for was great and service from Kylie was even better!
Great atmosphere and service.   My steak was very dry, and wasn't any better when they cooked a new one.  Great sides and Salmon was quite delicious.

Celebrated a very special occasion with my mom last night and the staff was so amazing. The food was incredible too; we especially recommend the lobster bisque soup, the golden beet salad, the carrot cake, and the chocolate lava cake. It was the staff that left us ready to come back for more, though.

Very cool place, kind of in an odd place, you have to go in a building and walk to it. Other than that no complaints. Nice view from within the city, priced pretty well for the quality of food. We went for my birthday and they gave us a free desert so huge shout out to them! Highly recommend for nice nights out for an anniversary, birthday, or to just have a nice sit down dinner!

Excellent restaurant. The service is really good. The location is great, it overlooks fountain square. We’ve had pizza, pasta and many of the appetizers and they are all amazing. I recommend the bruschetta and the fried cheese.

Still one of my favorite restaurants, although its lost some of its luster.  It's showing its age a bit.  Service doesn't quite have the intangible extra it once had.  The food is still good and it still has the spectacular view of Fountain Square.  Overall, very good, but not great.

We organised our corporate dinners here, so was our this one. Food was great & our colleagues have been taken care well. Ambiance was nice because we were larger group so they did provide us private room. They were only people who acknowledge our booking on Saturday for dinner placed on Monday. I give only 1 star less, just because my usual experience is time they take to serve food it can go up to an hour, so plan your time accordingly. While this might be just because they were trying to maintain quality or one of cook is on long weekend ;-)

Every time I go downtown to meet my investment team they always take me to palominos. They know it's my all-time favorite for lunch. Overlooks Fountain Square Downtown , perfect spot for lunch and dinner.

Really enjoyed my dinner here. I got the 32 oz beer and shrimp scampi. And it’s not skimpy at all! Very delicious and filling. The service was great. A lot of help. The beer garden looks like it would be amazing during the summer and with performances. Great German food.
Randy, our server was great. He made us feel right at home. The food was delicious & the atmosphere was very unique. So much history behind this restaurant. We had a good time.

Always has a great beer selection, great entertainment in the Biergarten.

We also hosted a private event here & they did a fantastic job with it. The servers were on top of things, food was great and the space was perfect. The event coordinators were very helpful to work with and gave great recommendations!

The starter bread basket comes with the best mustard in town.  Authentic German dishes and sides like none other served in the city, served in a romantic dining room, by sweet experienced staff.  I pleasantly full and going home happy with a couple more meals from my leftovers.

One of the places I visit while I have friends visiting town. It’s a cool German Restaurant located at the Mass Ave. area of Indianapolis. The atmosphere resembles a old style German Pub. The food and drinks selection are good. Service was OK and food is decently priced. Pretzels and spicy mustard are a must try!🥨🙂

Talk about amazing service. We were so lucky as to have Terry work with us tonight and it was an absolute delight. The recommendations were on point and each dish that came out had a wonderful flavor. Just excellent food itself is usually enough for me to leave a good review but I regret that I can't give them even more for the service and experience at Sullivan's!! It was such a memorable night for our group and a lot of it was due to the warm ambience and attentiveness!! Come here for great food and even better experience!

I love this place for celebrating anything important. This isn't an every day place, for sure, as it is expensive, even with the prix fix menu. The service is good. The food is excellent. Nice variety and atmosphere for a chain. The drinks are.good and strong.

Wow what a meal! Started with a cocktail to set the mood and the rest was a constant flow of appetizers, entrees, wine and dessert. The entertainment of watching the chefs working hard on the line keeps the energy of the restaurant high and happy. Service from the hostess to the water refresher was exceptional! Special thanks to Jason for such a delicious meal and PERFECTLY cooked steak! I will be back for that banana dessert again too!

Beautiful place. Servers are very well trained in explaining what cuts of steak and how the aging effects the meat. Sides are not included but are big enough portions for sharing with another person. Very large wine cellar which is in guest view. Live piano player in the lounge on a Saturday night who was very good. Pretty expensive, so it's definitely a place to be prepared for. Had a wonderful time and will go back again for a romantic getaway from the kids.

Thursday Happy Hour specials...open-10pm! What a terrific selection of drinks for $7 and apps half price. Live entertainment in the bar. This is a great place with incredible steaks. MUST order the BLT salad. It's unique and my favorite item. Top notch!

My wife and I took our three kids here for a Friday dinner after a long day at the children's museum. We we're so happy we did! I had the fish-n-chips and it was the best I have ever had. My wife had a salad and a soup and my kids all had kid meals. Everyone of us cleaned our plates, which is rare for my family. We we're delightfully impredded with the food. Portion sizes are just right and we ended up doing dessert too and had a fresh baked cookie with Guinness ice cream.

We will definitely go here again when we are in town. We had previously gone to the Weber Grill restaurant. This little pub had better food and our bill was half the cost.

Very good experience.  Everyone at our table thoroughly enjoyed their meal selections.  Good beers on tap.  Went back later in the evening.  Very good band playing in the evening.  Great.fun atmosphere.

It's been awhile since I've been here. The food has taken a dramatic downward slope. The service is nonexistent. Not horrible but far from good. Saw the waiter when I was seated when I got my good and when I got my check. Heard him often cussing and complaining about his apartment in the background. Won't be back.

I love this place. Good food and good service. My two favorites: Fish and Chips and Shepherd's Pie. Cheese and Sausage Boards great too.
.
Went here to celebrate St. Patty's day. Had some good food and listened to some music. The service was amazing for how busy they were! My friends and I had fun here!

Really enjoyed my dinner here. I got the 32 oz beer and shrimp scampi. And it’s not skimpy at all! Very delicious and filling. The service was great. A lot of help. The beer garden looks like it would be amazing during the summer and with performances. Great German food.
Randy, our server was great. He made us feel right at home. The food was delicious & the atmosphere was very unique. So much history behind this restaurant. We had a good time.

Always has a great beer selection, great entertainment in the Biergarten.

We also hosted a private event here & they did a fantastic job with it. The servers were on top of things, food was great and the space was perfect. The event coordinators were very helpful to work with and gave great recommendations!

The starter bread basket comes with the best mustard in town.  Authentic German dishes and sides like none other served in the city, served in a romantic dining room, by sweet experienced staff.  I pleasantly full and going home happy with a couple more meals from my leftovers.

One of the places I visit while I have friends visiting town. It’s a cool German Restaurant located at the Mass Ave. area of Indianapolis. The atmosphere resembles a old style German Pub. The food and drinks selection are good. Service was OK and food is decently priced. Pretzels and spicy mustard are a must try!🥨🙂
